bwwExcerpt: Seth Kubersky , Orlando Weekly: However, it isn’t too long into the first act before this hominy homily starts to reveal some lumps. Robert Horn’s joke-a-minute script extends a storybook-simple plot across two acts by padding it with a parade of age-old gags relying on heartland stereotypes and groan-inducing puns, from PG-13 rated dick humor to dad jokes that were already dated back when they were done on Hee-Haw. There’s no denying the lion’s share of laughs landed with Orlando’s opening nigh
